topic.title: Planning Releases, Sprints and Iterations
topic.p: If you plan to break down your project into sprints or iterations, we recommend you use Mingle's card trees.

screenshot.alttext: Tree view of a card tree

bullets.item:
Card trees provide additional card views, the tree view and hierarchy view. They allow you to easily see and manage the relationship between your cards.
e.g. Release -> Sprint -> Story -> Task -> Defect

You will get to use aggregate properties which are great for reporting on descendant cards.
e.g. calculating velocity for each sprint, counting the number of defects logged and fixed for each sprint or release, etc.
Keep your Mingle project simple. Introduce more complexity and structure as you need it. Ask yourself if you are getting value from each hierarchy in your card tree.
Create a few Mingle projects using Mingle's templates to see example card trees used in Scrum and XP projects.
